title: Archeotech Components
info:
# Archeotech Components

Archeotech is technology long-lost from the Imperium as a whole. Extremely valuable and efficient, these Components should only be available if the ship has the Reliquary of Mars Complication, the players earn them through their Warrant of Trade, or if the GM makes them available through the course of the game.

† This component may not be selected more than once per vessel

special.title: The Air is Sweet
special.effect: Increase Morale permanently by 2, reduce all losses to Crew Population due to non-combat sources by 1. This can be used as a ship's Life Sustainer.

special.title: The Air is Sweet
special.effect: Increase Morale permanently by 2, reduce all losses to Crew Population due to non-combat sources by 1. This can be used as a ship's Life Sustainer.

special.title: Overcharged
special.effect: The strange and exotic nature of the materials used in the drive's containment domes allows for a hotter plasma 'burn', while taking up less space. This adds +1 to the ship's Speed, decreases the space the drive takes up by 4, and is of extreme interest to agents of the Mechanicus.

special.title: Eyes Everywhere
special.effect: Add +10 to all Command Tests or social Skill Tests any character makes while on the bridge. This can be used as a ship's bridge.

special.title: Hololithic Display Tank
special.effect: Increase the ship's Manoeuvrability by +5.

special.title: Eyes Everywhere
special.effect: Add +10 to all Command Tests or social Skill Tests any character makes while on the bridge. This can be used as a ship's bridge.

special.title: Hololithic Display Tank
special.effect: Increase the ship's Manoeuvrability by +5.

special.title: Image of the Void
special.effect: Increase the ship's Detection by +5. This can be used as a ship's Auger Array.

special.title: External
special.effect: This Component does not require hull space. Although it is external, it can only be destroyed or damaged by a Critical Hit.

special.title: Targeting Matrix
special.effect: All Ballistic Skill Tests to fire the ship's weapons gain +5.

special.title: Surprise Strike
special.effect: Characters may make Hit and Run Attacks without a piloting test, as they travel directly to the heart of the enemy vessel. When using the teleportarium to perform such an attack, the attacker receives +20 to his Command Test. (The teleportarium may be used in any number of other ways, such as guaranteeing escape from sticky situations on a nearby planet, at the GM's discretion.)

special.title: Dampened Drives
special.effect: This Component grants a +15 bonus to the Silent Running Manoeuvre. Any attempts to detect the vessel (any actions that use a ship's Detection, such as the Active Augury Extended Action) suffer a -15 penalty.

special.title: Dampened Drives
special.effect: This Component grants a +15 bonus to the Silent Running Manoeuvre. Any attempts to detect the vessel (any actions that use a ship's Detection, such as the Active Augury Extended Action) suffer a -15 penalty.

special.title: Vortex Warhead
special.effect: The terrifying nature of vortex weaponry means a ship hit by a shot from this weapon (even if it does not do damage) immediately loses 1d5 Morale.

special.title: Core Architecture
special.effect: This weapon Component is always revealed by successful Active Augury—it is too large to be concealed.

special.title: Unstable Ammunition
special.effect: If a Jovian-pattern Nova Cannon is ever damaged, it is destroyed instead. In addition, as the ammunition explodes, the vessel is suffers 1d10 Hull Integrity Damage, ignoring armour or void shields.

special.title: Nova Cannon
special.effect: Damage 2d5+7. Range 6-35.

special.title: Torpedo Tubes
special.effect: Strength 4. This component can store sixteen torpedoes, plus an additional four if the ship's captain does not mind keeping four “in the tubes.” This follows all the rules for torpedo tubes

special.title: Hot Launch
special.effect: Torpedoes launched from this Component gain an additional +4 VU speed on the turn they are launched, after which they revert to normal.

special.title: Augur Accuracy
special.effect: Torpedoes launched from this Component gain a +10 bonus to hit.

special.title: Volatile
special.effect: If this Component is Damaged or Destroyed (but not Unpowered or Depressurised) while torpedoes are loaded, it has a 5% chance of exploding. In this event, the Component is destroyed and the ship takes 2d5 Hull Integrity damage.

special.title: His Holy Light
special.effect: The Navigator receives a +20 bonus to all tests to Locate the Astronomican.

special.title: Beacon
special.effect: In addition to increasing the navigator's sensitivity, this Component also makes the vessel much more noticeable to others in the warp. Vessels equipped with a Warp Antenna suffer a -10 modifier on Warp Travel Encounter Tests.

special.title: External
special.effect: This Component does not require hull space. Although it is external, it can only be destroyed or Damaged with a Critical Hit.

special.title: The True Path
special.effect: When using a Warp Sextant, the Navigator receives a +20 bonus on any Perception Tests or Navigation (Warp) Tests made to steer the vessel through the warp.

special.title: Void Shield Array
special.effect: This Component counts as a ship's Void Shield, giving the ship one void shield.

special.title: Fail-safes
special.effect: Once per Strategic Round, during one opponent's Strategic Turn, the ship's Enginseer may make a Difficult (-10) Tech-Use Test. This does not count as the Enginseer's Extended Action. If he succeeds, the ship doubles its number of Void Shields for the duration of a single opponent's Strategic Turn.

special.title: Void Shield Array
special.effect: This Component counts as a ship's Void Shields, giving the ship two void shields.

special.title: Fail-safes
special.effect: Once per Strategic Round, during one opponent's Strategic Turn, the ship's Enginseer may make a Difficult (-10) Tech-Use Test. This does not count as the Enginseer's Extended Action. If he succeeds, the ship doubles its number of Void Shields for the duration of a single opponent's Strategic Turn.

special.title: Sophisticated Cogitation Operation
special.effect: This starship's Crew Rating gains a +5 bonus.

special.title: Redirect Power to Engines
special.effect: The ship's captain can choose to activate the conversion matrix at any time as a free action. When he does so, he decreases the amount of Power generated by the ship and increases its Speed value. Frigates and raiders can exchange 3 Power for 1 Speed. Light cruisers can exchange 4 Power for 1 Speed. Transports and Cruisers can exchange 5 Power for 1 Speed. A ship's Speed value cannot be increased by more than 5 using this Component. A captain may divert Power being used to power other Components, however, if he does so, the Component becomes unpowered for as long as the conversion matrix is used.

special.title: Aid of the Machine-Spirit
special.effect: When this ship performs the Adjust Speed and Bearing, Come to New Heading, and Evasive Manoeuvres Manoeuvre Actions, its Operate (Voidship) + Manoeuvrability Test counts as Challenging (+0).

special.title: Macrobattery
special.effect: Strength 4. Damage 1d10+2. Crit Rating 4. Range 12.

special.title: Pinpoint accuracy
special.effect: This weapon scores an additional hit for every two degrees of success, rather than every three

special.title: Lance
special.effect: Strength 3. Damage 1d10+3. Crit Rating 3. Range 7.

special.title: Blessing of the Omnissiah
special.effect: When Crippled, the Captain may choose to have either his Weapon Components or his Speed unaffected by the usual penalties for crippled ships.

special.title: Volatile
special.effect: If the Emergency Energy Reserves are damaged, the Component has a 25% chance of exploding. In this event, the Component is destroyed, the ship takes 1d5 damage to Hull Integrity, and a Component of the GM's choice is set on fire.

special.title: Blessing of the Omnissiah
special.effect: When Crippled, the Captain may choose to have either his Weapon Components or his Speed unaffected by the usual penalties for crippled ships.

special.title: Volatile
special.effect: If the Emergency Energy Reserves are damaged, the Component has a 25% chance of exploding. In this event, the Component is destroyed, the ship takes 1d5 damage to Hull Integrity, and a Component of the GM's choice is set on fire.

special.title: Convenient Flux
special.effect: When triggered, all vessels in the star system suffer a -30 to their Detection for 2 Strategic Rounds.

special.title: Extended Recovery
special.effect: The Graviton Flare requires twenty-four hours to recharge between uses.

special.title: External
special.effect: This Component does not require hull space. Although it is external, it can only be destroyed or damaged by a Critical Hit.

special.title: Witch hold
special.effect: This hold allows transport of up to 100 psykers in solitary containment cells. When secured in a cell, all Focus Power Tests made to activate psychic abilities (or any other tests involving warp powers such as a test to use a Navigator's warp eye) suffer a -60 penalty. When working towards an appropriate Criminal Objective, the players earn an additional 50 Achievement Points towards completing that objective.

special.title: The Keening
special.effect: Whenever this bay is in use, decrease Morale by 3 as a result of the psychic residue of misery from its prisoners.

special.title: Slumbering Crew
special.effect: When active, the vessel's Crew Population is decreased by 50 and its Morale is decreased by 5. When the device is deactivated, Crew Population recovers the full 50 points, but Morale does not recover. It takes a full day's work to awaken all the crew.

special.title: Stretch the Rations
special.effect: When in use, a ship may double the time it may remain in the void without suffering Crew Population or Morale Loss.

special.title: Slumbering Crew
special.effect: When active, the vessel's Crew Population is decreased by 50 and its Morale is decreased by 5. When the device is deactivated, Crew Population recovers the full 50 points, but Morale does not recover. It takes a full day's work to awaken all the crew.

special.title: Stretch the Rations
special.effect: When in use, a ship may double the time it may remain in the void without suffering Crew Population or Morale Loss.

special.title: Plumb the Immaterium
special.effect: A Navigator may use this device to make a Challenging (+0) Awareness Test. If successful, the Navigator can identify nearby vessels (or other large objects) and estimate when and where they are likely to transition out of the warp. For every degree of success, the Navigator can sense objects within a range of about one hour's travel.

special.title: External
special.effect: This Component does not require hull space. Although it is external, it can only be destroyed or damaged by a Critical Hit.
